properties.jEOC Final Description: Premise is  3s stories wood frame MD with undergoing gut renovation w/out permit. 3rd floor has been guttered down to beams, demo started on the 1st&2nd floors. Violation issued
At 2nd floor created illegal occupancy with no 2nd means of egress. No in juries reported. Violations & vacate issued.
A section of wood cornice is dislodging  from framing. No injuries reported. Violation issued.
At time of inspection at exp 1 at 2nd and 3rd flrs right corner masonry ornamental veneer approx 2'x2' dislodged from facade and fell to shed that was in place.. Violation issued
Tenant from apt. 2B  indicated that workers repaired ceiling and refused to allow us access.  No injuries reported.
Siding  has come loose and fallen to sidewalk below. No injuries reported. Violation issued.

At time of inspection exterior wall along side Saratoga Ave has not been maintained at exposure 1and now pieces of masonry are cracked and have dislodged and other sections are bulged and uneven at the 3rd and 4th floor levels. Violations issued.
All tenants will enter and exit service entrance of building only until loose panels can be removed from cooling tower. NYPD posted at site for safety and security until hazardoius condition remedied
Premise is 3 stories vacant semi-attached masonry mixed use building. There are minor vertical cracks at exposure#2 masonry veneer. There was no danger to the public. DOB issued violations.
Section of masonry collapse onto front yard area of 705 Dekalb Avenue and injured a individual. The injured civilian/pedestrian was transported to an area hospital. OATH violation issued.

Premise is vacant lot with undergoing pre-excavation pile installation. Workers on the site reported that load was intentionally shifted  and dropped in order to wrap sling, cell reception in area is reportedly spotty. Violation issued
Section of rear wall has collapse to ground. No injuries reported. Vioaltion & vacate issued.
SWO issued for failure to conform to approved plans and failure to safeguard

Premise is a one story, 20'X20', brick and block garage, wood framed roof on slab. Roof collapsed at exposure one also knocking down facade wall. At exposure # three the roof is leaning on the rear wall adjacent to the rear yard of 148 Wyckoff Ave. (vacating rear yard of #148 Wyckoff Ave.)
At exposure 4, the corner brick missing at the roof level was taken care of on 11/12/16.  No issues observed at exposure 1.
An ornamental masonry section approx. 6"x 6 " at the 3rd floor has fallen to the public sidewalk. Violation and an Immediate Emergency Declaration for a sidewalk shed issued.

The Site Safety Manager reported that a worker was climbing up a drill rigg when a bolt snapped, causing the drill head assembly and the worker to fall to the ground. The worker suffered minor injuries and was taken to Belleview Hospital, where he was released after a short period of time. No equipment maintenance logs were provided at the time of inspection. An ECB Violaton was issued for a failure to safeguard. Additional violations were issued for there being no approved plans on site and monitoring/inspector reports on site.
A partial collapse ceiling in apartment 4L in the kitchen / dining area. 1 injury to a tenent was reported. The tenant was taken to a local hospital by EMS.
At roof level no holes observed. No injuries reported. No Action Necessary.
At exposure 2, 1st floor brick wall has bulge near front of building.  No interior cracks or separation other than at window. No injuries reported. Violation issued.

3 story mixed use occupancy. Excavation at adjacent lot(1336 Myrtle Ave) has caused cellar floor to crack at various locations. Site does have a Stop Work Order from 4/28/14 but has been partially rescinded on this date for corrective work. ECB issued

There is extensive interior and exterior damage. Engineer inspected site and concluded that there is no eminent threat to the public or adjacent property. No injuries reported. Violation & vacate issued.

The premises is a 4 story mixed use NFP building. The defect is at the 3rd floor window at exposure 1. There is a small section of the masonry lintel spalled and fell to the public walk. There were no injuries reported.

Premise is 3 stories MD. 1st floor drop ceiling was separated from the lath ceiling.At time of inspection Partitions wall have been removed w/out permit. Illegal ocupancy was found in the basement. Violation issued

4 story mixed use building. Area in front of building taped off due to window glass that has fallen from 3rd. Floor window onto sidewalk at front façade additional defective windows at 3rd. + 4th. Floors with rotted wooden frames ECB and DEC issued.
Premise is 3 stories, class 3 occupied attached MD, masonry chimney at the rear at exposure#3 was leaning out of plumb. There was no danger of collapse. Violation issued

Building is a 4 story building performing Gut Rehabilitation throughout under application # 321637468. During demolition operation of walls for pockets to accommodate steel erection on 2nd floor level at exposure 3, chipping hammer punch a hole into adjoining property at 2 Spencer Court 1st floor apartment no injury reported, Construction operation will be issued a Full Stop Work Order for failure to Safeguard public and property for damage that occur additional Summons and Stop Work Order will be issued for Housekeeping, Existing elements not maintain, Holes not cover, no design drawings provided for hoisting equipment ,sidewalk shed does not meet code requirements and there were no notification to the department for accident. General Contractor will be require to provide safety measures for operation going forward to safeguard public and property.
At time of inspection there was no damaged motor vehicle. There is a sidewalk shed installed along exposures 1 & 4. Defective brick work and masonry was noted and a violation was issued.

Four joists in cellar are rotted deteriorated at the pockets of foundation wall at the exposure 4 side of the building. Partial vacate for the restrooms above and a  ECB violation issued for failure to maintain

Premises is a 4 story mixed-use masonry building.  At 1st flloor  2 active permits for work being done.No work occurring at time of inspection.  No structural issues observed at the time of inspection. No injuries reported.

Premises is a 4 story Mixed use with the first floor vacant. Section  of masonry above the window of the third floor has come loose and fallen to the ground. (With no injuries reported ) Residuals were removed.
Spoke with homeowner on street and he refused access to premises.
At time of inspection A and B lines (front) cannot utilize there second means of egress due to work and removal of ladders.

Premises is a 2 story wood frame non fire proof structure with a cellar and sub cellar and situated as 4 family residence.  At cellar level the flooring is severely rotted uneven & sagging with soft pockets through out entire flooring and being used to store catering equipment carrying a lot of weight. Walls have separated from ceiling above and door frames are completely out of plumb. Condition of flooring at cellar and sub cellar is showing signs of structural failure FULL VACATE ISSUED
Adjacent Demo site at 622 Myrtle Ave job #321270940  has reduced the adjacent masonry wall to one wythe of brick at various areas. SWO, OATH and DOB violations issued.
A section of roof  has partially collapsed into interior due to a lack of maintenance. No injuries reported. Violation issued.
Stucco around windows at left side of exposure 1 first and second story fallen to ground level.  No injuries reported, OATH violations issued.
Demo and rehab work being done without a permit of a three story wood frame interior attach bldg. At exposure one gable roof bricks collapsed onto sidewalk shed causing shed to partially collapse.

The cellar has new full height partitions, a 3 piece bathroom, new hi-hat lighting with switches and plugs. Laundry area has slop sink and gas line. No evidence of occupancy observed. No permits have been issued for work. Violation issued.
There was no work being done in the building. Workers work on the sidewalk  and all DOT permits posted. There was no action necessary for ERT
Steel shed 12 ft x 25 ft x 12 ft H installed at rear blocking rear fire. escape.
A vehicle struck SWS on exposure 4 on Harmon Street.  No injuries reported.  OATH andDOB violations issued.
Structure sustained a collapse on the interior floors due to deterioration of floor joists. Interior walls have collapsed within at all floors. No injuries reported. Violation & vacate issued.

Address which previously was a dry cleaner, had a complete gut demolition which included removal of floor joists at second floor. The premises is stable due to the fact that it  is attached to adjacent buildings. DEP has documented readings of more than 100ppm's. of the chemical Perchloroethylene. Violations were issued for the construction work. D.E.P. To determine probable vacate of adjoining structures due to the high readings

At time of inspection entire structure found to be in a complete state of disrepair with the possibility of collapse therefore the entire structure including side yards and rear yard to be vacated. Violation and vacate issued

FDNY REQUESTS A STRUCTURAL STABILITY INSPECTION DUE TO CRACKS IN THE EXTERIOR WALL. :  AT TIME OF MY INSPECTION OBSERVED EXP-2 ADJACENT PROPERTY AT 127 EAGLE STREET 4 STORY OCCUPIED BUILDING CRACKS HAS BEEN FOUND VERTICALLY AND HORIZONTALLY. CREATING A DANGERIOUS CONDITIONS FOR ALL PERSONS PUBLIC AND PROPERTY. DOB VIOLATIONS SERVED.

3 story, NFP, attached, with flat roof with basement and cellar under alteration.  Parapet/party wall leans at exposure 3 and 4. Observed on the plan that parapet wall to be replaced,  However it was observed that parapet party wall had be cover to protect adjoining property from water damage with section in the middle broken down.

Premises is a 4 story brick frames building under interior renovation via application 320775602. The location is unnocupied except for tenants in 4R. No work was in progress at time of inspection, completed work observed included electrical and plumbing work no covered by approved permit. Contractor has installed a plywood wall at the rear of apt 4R obstructing occupants access to the fire escape
. There is a vertical crack that is running from 1st. Floor up to parapet on the #2 side of building. There is no danger of collapse at this time.

The staircase between the 2nd  and 3rd floors is sagging approx 6 inches with the stringer cracked and detached and in danger of total collapse. FDNY installed temporary shoring to remove occupants safely from 3 and 4 floors.
At right side of building, several large section of the façade have deteriorated and has fallen. No injuries reported.  Full Vacate, DOB and ECB violations issued.
Piece of loose 2×4 while being removed along parapet fell inside property line with no damage to property.  No injuries reported.  DOB violation issued.

There were no stones falling at the time of inspection from the 2nd floor. Defects found at the 4th story front façade, at exposure#1,  left window sill and vertical ornamental stone element spalled, broke apart and fell into the entrance walkway and sidewalk. Violation issued

Premises is a 4 story wood frame non fireproof building with masonry exterior wall that is in a state of disrepair due to sections of façade that has detached from the 4th floor and fallen to the ground along exposure #1. The remaining loose sections have been removed but cracks observed forming throughout 4th floor façade. Owner on site attempting to secure shed contractor, also observed balcony and door installed on the 3rd floor without any permits. IED to be drafted in the event the owner fails to act.

A front wall approx. 70" x 12" to a commercial businness collapssed due to work being done  at other areas leaving front wall freestanding. Violation, Immidiate Emergency Declaration and a full stop work order issued.
A section of brownstone facade had spalled and had fallen to sidewalk. No injures reported. Violation issued.

A section of non bearing front masonry wall approximately 20' wide by 6' in height had fallen back onto new deck & the rear non bearing wall appears stable with some bulging present. No injuries reported.  Violation & stop work order has been issued.

A 1ft x 4 ft piece of decorative masonry. There are several defects none immenant at this time. The owner on scene and in process of obtaining shed company. Violation and an Immediate Emergency Declaration has been issued.
At time of inspection FDNY removed all loose material prior to inspection. ED prepared for a sidewalk shed to be erected . Violation issued

At time of inspection the facade above the 3rd floor window  had  a section of ornamental stone detach and has fallen to the ground below. The brownstone sections remaining from grade to roof  appear to be  loose and have a slight bulge. Violation and Immediate Emergency Dclaration issued.
Premise is 3 stories attached wood frame structure with full masonry façade at exposure#1 is pulling away from the structure approx.4’x6’ between 2nd&3rd stories. Violation issued
Exposure 1 parapet having loose and fallen brick work go beyond shed and striking two vehicles on street. No injuries reported. Violation & stop work order issued.
While workers were replacing a terracotta stone window lintel with steel and brick, some debris fell down to sidewalk. No injuries reported. Violation & stop work order issued.
At time of inspection work on 4th floor apt. created ceiling in apt. below to collapse. Violation and partial vacate issued.

Premise is a 3 story mixed use attached building. Commercial space on 1st floor with apartments located above. No bowing observed at 1st or 2nd floor.  No stress cracks or separation on interior walls at 1st and 2nd floors.
A squatter in building took a bat and hit ceiling on 4th. Floor causing an approx. 3' x 3' section of plaster and metal lath to fall.
Premises is a 3 story, 3 family , wood frame building, with a cellar level. Premises has a legal use of a multiple dwelling.
Section of the stucco has fallen onto the sidewalk. No injuries reported. Violation issued.
At  time of inspection at roof level the wood cornice has detached and  fallen onto side walk front yard outside seating area . Violation, Immediate Emergency Declaration anpartial vacate issued.
A piece of metal hanging from the building. No injuries reported. Violation issued.

Premises is a 3 story woodframe mix use, NFP structure that at cellar level rear approximately 5 floor joists are  deteriorated and cracked on foundation wall also main gerder is split and cracked for entire run and is detriorated. Rear portion approx 1' of gerder is rotted and issing at rear wall and now section is held up with temp shoring . Excessive water damage is evident at rear apartents on the 2ND and 3Rd floors and floors are sloping.

Five story structure under renovation (vertical extension). Building is unoccupied. Foundation wall are rear partially demoed to create new door opening approx. 3’W for entrance to cellar level. Rear yard excavated approx.: 8’D x 5’W Sheer cut with no protection at sides. Partial SWO issued for work at cellar rear.
Excavation at 42 Cooper Street under permit # 321386558 with underpinning in progress cracks have developed at rear of building at corner exp 2+ 3.  Full Stop Work Order, DOB and OATH

Premises is a 6 stories, 59 families residential building. Brick masonry construction exterior with a cellar level, no basement. Premises has a legal use of as a multiple dwelling. Failure to maintain building exterior walls at exposure 1, left wall of entrance court, some bricks are spalling. Violations issued.
The brick came from an abandon fireplace  chimney and they did not fall they was thrown from the building onto the street.  No inuries reported. Violation issued.
Both chimneys are leaning inward, spalling, and defective with deteriorated mortar joints and chimney toward front has some missing brickwork. No injuries reported. Violation issued.

bulging along exposure # 2 near corner of exposures #1 and #2, at tier between basement and 1st floor. Facade at affected area is pulling away from structure with evident of a 4 inch gap between brick wall and window lintel. No injuries reported. Violation issued.

Premises is a 3 story NFP previously vacated site for a full gut demo and defective egress on 06/17/2012 VO#061712CNETZ FDNY responded to a fire because workers were dismantling the steel 2ndFl fire escape with a torch
The chimney separation from the main structure from the 2nd floor to the roof line and above.  No injuries reported.  Partial Vacate & OATH.
Brick chimney split apartment on the 1st floor rear, apartment is in danger of collapsing into apartment. Chimney split apartment approx. 8 inches. Violation issued
Premise is 4 stories building with a section of cornice  5'x8' fell from exposure#1 from the 3rd floor level. Violation issued
No Action Necessary

1/4 inch vertical  and diagonal cracking from construction occurring at 576 6th Avenue under alt #340784536 in adjacent building.  No injuries reported.  Stop Work Order, OATH summons and DOB violation issued.
Entire rear facade wall structurally compromised and potential collapse condition. No injuries reported.

There was no construction activity at the time of inspection. Premise is 4 stories mixed use vacant building. At exposure#2, at the rear of the building, brick fell onto the adjacent roof top. Violations issued
This is a recurring condition from incident #19437 on 04/24/15 Structural follow up was requested by FEU.
Brick nogging fell off, eaving the wall without blocking or bracing for studs. No injuries reported. Violations & stop work order issued.

Premise is a 4 story mix use, wood frame with basement occupied as a restaurant.  Basement occupied as restaurant but C of O records indicates it to be used as a Tailor Shop. 1st floor class “A” apt. created. C of O shows it to be used as a photo studio and office. Wooden public hall stairs are sloping and sagging from second floor to 4th floor, walls show several cracks on the public hall. Several rooms are vacant and they are in disrepair, plaster has fallen and evidence of water leaks. Boiler has been shut down by FDNY due to high levels of CO. Sewage back up in the cellar.
ERT Squad Three reports location is a 3 story multiple dwelling with no structural cracks at exposure 1.

Premise is 4 stories semi-attached masonry structure, portion of parapet at exposure#1 fell into the sidewalk shed. Exposure#1 parapet wall is in disrepair, there are loose masonry throughout. Violation issued
Building contractor removing existing windows has pieces fall to pedestrian path. No injuries reported. Violation & stop work issued.

There is interior renovation going on under expired permit No. 320983888. The inspection revealed no fall protection at 2nd floor stairs, no "NO SMOKING" and contractor's signs posted. Existing fire escape removed and open holes throughout. There is also evidence of work contrary throughout site. Rear existing frame facade (10 ft x 41 ft.) removed and replaced, fire division wall removed and new steel structural beams and posts installed & double headers missing. A full SWO & violations were issued.
Stucco finish at the exposure 2 side of building has spalled off in two separate sections and has fallen down into front yard and onto roof at 154 Jefferson Avenue. Violations and vacate issued.

Premise is 4 stories mixed use attached building. Illegal work ongoing on the 1st floor at the retail space, removing floor joists, sub flooring, partitions. 1st floor  was completely demoed w/out issuance of any plans or permits. Violation issued

At time of inspection the 3rd story tenant, related to building owner living on the duplex apt, installed in the roof 2 small gas fuel electric generators to provide electric power to his apt. He was running several electrical extension cords from the roof into the 3rd story apt. Generators were placed directly onto the flammable roof surface. Violation issued
3story masonry multiple dwelling with cellar that at the front facade cracks are evident in the stucco finish at the parapet level were a small section detached an other cracks are evident
Masonry decorative pillar detached and fallen over entry way and pubic sidewalk. No injuries reported. Violations & vacate issued.

Cellar ceiling joists are deteriorated and deflection of approx 8 in. is evident at 2 locations. A partial vacate order was also warranted to the 1st floor (one apartment) for structural stability. Violations and a partial vacate issued.

Department records show building as a NFP 3 story five family with cellar. Premises observed to be semi attached,  under entire interior renovation without permits. Entire  wall at exposure 3  has collapsed into the rear of the location exposing complete rear interior of premises. No injuries have been reported. No workers or building representatives on site.

In the basement a section of the rubble foundation wall was being worked on at exposure #2. The wall collapsed causing the adjoining property, 210 Freeman Street exposure #4 to collapse along with it. No injuries reported. Violations, a full stop work & full vacate issued.

At time of visit, interior appeared gut renovation throughout. Stucco at rear wall was bulging and partially collapsed/peeled off. Exposure #4 wall appeared no siding and was coved with tarps. Brick wall at Exposure #1 was slightly bulging, and first level was observed detached from building. No action necessary
Pieces of rotted wood trim fell from cornice onto sidewalk. No injuries reported. Violation issued.
At front facade, decorative brownstone around windows have areas that are cracked with pieces missing and on sidewalk.
The building interior is in a state of disrepair. No injuries reported.
Department records show building as frame construction 6 family, three story with cellar. Inspection finds stairs from 2nd to 3rd floor have separation of steps and are in danger of collapse.

At the rear one story extension, a section of tin ceiling is broken thus exposing cracked and compromised strong back and joists. Remainder of ceiling shows evidence of past water damage.  Violation & a vacate  issued
Non structural damage with rubble stone foundation in place without defect.
LS-4 posted, no access

At time of inspection front facade of this 3 story mixed use building with no defects observed at time of inspection.  Premises does have a stop work order dated 5/15/15 ( with no construction activity ) with interior renovations present.

Premise is 3 stories wood frame dwelling. Interior of building gutted down to beams and joists w/out permits. Structural elementswere removed, causing building to severly rack,compromising structural integrity. Building is in danger of collapse.

Along left exposure of garage, small section of stucco on sheathing has cracked open. Previously open garage roof has been repaired. Front frame awning is pulling away from main building. (Temporary supports in place). Building is being occupied without a valid certificate of occupancy & the previously vacated garage and now has been re-occupied. Violations issued.

Premises is a 5 story Non fireproof multiple dwelling with cellar. Failure to maintain has resulted in a condition on exposure 4 @ 5th floor corner where bricks were observed to be loose, cracked and bulging.

At time of inspection a piece of sheet rock is missing from the bathroom ceiling of the 1st floor , left , rear apt. There are no visible structural issues . There is no danger of further collapse. Violation issued
At the rear of the building middle section of bricks fell from wall between first and second floor.  No injuries, OATH summons issued.
Sections of the cornice at the roof level have separated and fallen onto pedestrian walkway along Lee Avenue No injuries reported. Violation issued.
ECB Violation issued for failure to maintain and failure to file certificates of correction. IED has been put into process.
Building has major lean to the right at exposure#4. Premise is 4 stories semi-attached wood frame MD. Violation issued

FDNY requests a structural stability inspection due to holes throughout, exposing building to elements. Premise is a 2 ½ story wood frame detached building. At time of inspection building is in a state of disrepair with façade missing exposing interior to the elements, also 1st and 2nd floor are vacant and appears to be structurally compromised. Utilities have been disconnected to the building and the cellar is being occupied by 1 person
Sewer line in the cellar is clogged and  a heating line split, causing flooding on the 2nd floor. Violation issued

Premises is a four story occupied, mixed use Brownstone. At second story front, approximately a 6 foot by 6 inch section of decorative window jamb had fallen to sidewalk below. No injuries were reported. Area was taped off and shortly after a shed was erected complete with lighting,
In cellar installed I-beams and posts with bolts and tack welds,also installed screw jacks for lumber shoring. No permits for work. SWO in place also exit to scuttle locked. Violations issued
At garage 2 defective joists cracked thru leaving the corner at exposure 3 unsupported.Violation issued.
Stucco along exposure 2 is defective approximately 3ft x 5ft section has fallen to adjoining property and public sidewalk.

All permits posted and valid. FDNY requested a structural stability check due to an excavation next to the adjacent property which is. 240 Ainsley street Brooklyn. Excavation has exposed the random rubble foundation of 240 Ainsley street Brooklyn. Excavation is approx. 4'deepX30'long which is contrary to the approved plans.
A bilco door was open with loose concrete. No injuries reported.

Premises is a 3 story class 3 occupied multiple. Inspection made with FDNY. Minor crack in cellar slab, unable to determine if due to new building next door known as 383 12 street which is to a height of the second story. Cellar of 385 12 street arranged and occupied as illegal apartment with 2 bedrooms, kitchen with gas stove, and a bathroom. Partial vacate order stickers posted for cellar only for inadequate egress, light, and air.
Masonry has fallen into front set-back area. No injuries reported. Vioaltion issued.
A section of the brick facing on the facade had become loose and had fallen on to the side walk. No injuries reported. Violation issued.

Inspector Markowski reported, FDNY was not on site. The site was chained and no one was found working, nom activity. The site was accessible and unguarded. The job is under SWO and being under audit by CSE engineers with limited work allowed. The C license is expired. The owner was contacted for sending someone to lock the site. Owners representative arrived and secured the site. No enforcement action was taken.

Sections of concrete stucco laminate has detached and fallen into adjacent property's (164 Suydam Street) active driveway causing damage to two vehicles.  No injuries reported.  Partial Vacate, OATH summons and DOB violations issued.
Wall is in disrepair with a section of Brick veneer pulling away from facade at first floor. No injuries reported. Violation issued.

Premises is a 4 story m/d with ground level store front church for approx 20 persons. Facade at front has cracked and defective decorative masonry at various locations/elevations at west exposure. Area has been taped off and NYPD post maintained. Owner on scene and in process of contacting shed contractor. ECB violation #041313CNER01, 35015072-Z issued to owner on scene due to a failure to maintain bldg. ERT ops will conclude with paper work. Note: m/d and church do have an additional means of egress at unaffected east side of bldg. Recommend follow up for shed protection
at time of inspection at second floor a section of masonry stone header above window approximately 18"'s has fallen to ground . Violation and an immediate emergenct declaration issued.
Vinyl siding section loose and in danger of falling.  OATH violation issued.

Premises is a 3 story wood frame NFP multiple dwelling with cellar that has damage to exterior exposure 2 wall a section of approx 15'X15' has collapsed into adjacent open lot. A joint inspection was conducted with F.E.U and it was determined that main building and adjacent open lot be vacated and an entire structural evaluation be conducted. ARC has relocated 6 persons from premises.

Premises is a 3 story wood framed mixed use building with cellar. Inspection finds first floor joists at rear of cellar, the last joist has become twisted, cracked and deteriorated. This condition has disturbed the flooring in the 1st floor commercial space causing it to become warped and uneven.

AT TIME OF INSPECTION IT WAS OBSERVED THAT DUE TO ONGOING UP WORK AT CONSTRUCTION SITE 579 LINDEN ST HAS CREATED AT VERTICAL CRACK  AT EXPOSURE #1,EXPOSSURE#2 CORNER ON BUILDING#357 LINDEN ST .WE REQUESTED INMEDIATE PRESENCE OF THE SURVEYOR TO KEEP TRACK OF FURTHER MOVEMENTS . CONTRACTOR WAS DIRECTED  TO CREATE A BERM AT EXPOSURE#2.EOR WAS ON SITE AND WAS DIRECTED TO PERFORM STABILITY REPORT OF ADJOINING BUILDING#357 ,CONTRACTOR WILL MONITOR CONSTRUCTION SIYTE AND CRACKS GAGES WERE INSTALLED TO KEEP TRACK OF OPENING .FULL SWO SERVED AND ECB VIOLATION ISSUED
Premise is 4 stories vacant masonry dwelling. Sidewalk is in state of disrepair at exposure#1, approx.3x4 section due to metal frame of vault corroded. Violation issued
Premise is 3 stories stucco/framed building. Building is shifted from right to left, there is a store on the 1st floor. Violations issued

The exterior wall has defective stucco, bulging and cracked at several locations.between 1st & 2nd floor. At adjacent property defects found at 4320 4th Avenue, the parapet wall and rear chimney are leaning inward, missing coping stones. Violations issued

Three story three family masonry building sustained severe damage to front façade (exposure 1), as a result of parapet wall approximately 3’H x 20’L collapsing unto public side walk below. No injuries reported and a full vacate order was issued.

At time of inspection cellar has been fully gutted at interior at all levels. Exposure (1) front at 2nd and 3rd floor levels noticeable pulling away and splitting is evident from adjacent attached property located at exposure 2 side.ECB and stop work order issued.

The FDNY requested that a structural stability inspection please be performed due to the presence of a vertical crack at the front of a vacant building. A DOB inspector reported that a crack had appeared between exposures 1 & 2, running from the cellar through the roof line, and that the rear wall of the building was cracked from the cellar through the roof. The building interior as partially demolished. An ECB Violation, a DOB Violation, a Stop Work Order, an Emergency Declaration, and a vacate to park adjacent to the building vacated were all issued.

Premise is a wood frame semi-attached two story commercial space with one floor and cellar. Building is occupied as a daycare center and does not have a valid C of O. Sprinkler system under job#320484999 01 A2 signed off 09/06/2012. Class room 201 located at cellar level metal frame support system failure causing drop down ceiling to collapse. Room dimension approx. 18’ by 18’. No adult or children were injured at time of incident. A partial vacate will be issued for room 201 located at cellar due to partial collapse of ceiling, no additional damages observed.

At time of inspection chimney at roof level chimney leaning outward has dislodged bricks falling  into courtyard below, Courtyard will be vated. Violation, Immediate Emergency Declaration and vacate for yard issued.
Premise is 4 stories semi-attached masonry structure, legal use MD. Decorative façade/cornice was broken off the building and fell into the public sidewalk. Violation issued
Premise is 4 stories MD masonry, semi-attached. Metal stairs on the 1st floor were installed to replace wooden  stairs. All work complies with approved plans. No violations issued, no action taken
Wood cornice above third story at front parapet approx. 25’-0” feet in length has collapsed to sidewalk without any reported injuries. Violation issued.
The open roof has defective joists with steps cracks along exposure 2 with sagging masonry partially collapsed chimney with possible collapse of remaining masonry

Premise is 3 stories building with permit posted for façade work. There were no workers at the site at the time of inspection. Building is not occupied, there are no permits for waste lines/plumbing work/no contractors’ sigh posted/no smoking signs. Full SWO prepared. Violations issued
A resident was struck by some plaster during renovation. The resident was taken to the hospital by ambulance.
Premise is 3 stories brick and wood frame mixed use row house. At the time of inspection, roll-down gate has dislodged from the building and partially collapsed. Violations issued

Initial report was to check structural stability of façade. Premise is 4 stories mixed use occupied brick commercial bar with defective brick work pulling away at South/West corner on the 2nd floor at the roof. Tree branches are leaning onto the brickwork Violation isused
Adjacent 3 Story garage has concrete displacement at low level. At time of inspection  work at jobb site had no impack on concrete being dis lodged
At time of inspection due to rotted detaching steel support beam at front sidewalk coillapsed into cellar. Entire bldg unsafe to occupy.Violation and vacate issued.
At rear of building a section of façade plaster  with lathe,  detached and fell onto neighbors rear yard at 72- 1 place. No injuries reported. Partial Vacate Order, OATH and DOB violations issued.

At time of inspection currently gutted the entire interior removing everything including floor joists plus entire roof and is now installing new horizontal floor joist at the mid section of the 3rd and 4th floors and failed to provide an shoring or safeguard for remaining unstable sections and exposed masonry walls. There were no plans provided by any works or persons at location. Violations and Full stop work order issued.
Swo issued for failure to protect adjacent property
Approx one foot wide by five foot high  ( 1'- 0" X 5'- 0" ) section of masonry had fallen from 4th story to sidewalk without any reported injuries.  Violation issued.
A section of brownstone header has dislodged and fallen onto fire escape. No injuries reported. Violation issued.

Premises is a four (4) story class 3 occupied multiple dwelling. Approx six (6) foot long X approx three (3) foot high section of brick parapet fell onto roof at rear toward center. Additional sections of brick work is defective with open and eroded mortar joints at various locations at rear. No injuries were reported with this incident
Premise is residential 4 stories townhouse, masonry construction attached building under demolition w/out permit. Violation issued
At time of inspection existing cellar access stair has been removed and no fall protection is in place. Violation issued

4 story,wood frame,mixed use attached building with cellar. Top of building overhang is leaning downward. Roof has peak with snow accumulated and slides down toward leaning overhang. Area roped off by FDNY. ED for SWS needed.
Premise is 15 stories masonry building. A motor vehicle was shattered by unknown source. No evidence of any material or debris falling, there was no unsafe conditions.

It was reported by the inspector that worker got injuried by falling debris. No information was provided on condition of worker.does not appear to be serious. He went home for the day. SWO issued along with 4 Safety related violations
An area approx. 4’ x 8’ of missing & loose stucco has been removed but there are additional areas that are in need attention. Violation issued.
Walls have been removed at first floor level causing settlement. No injuries reported. Violations & vacate issued.

SSM reported that a small blow out of concrete occurred while pouring columns. Premises is working under New Building application #104297850. While pouring an interior column, form was braced with metal bands that couldn’t support the load causing the form work to fail. CEU will issue a Partial Stop Work Order for failure to provide approved design drawing for interior column 16 Feet in height. Formwork that exceeds 14 Feet in height requires a approve design drawing. Site was allowed to complete structural concrete placement on 5/30/13. No injuries reported

Premise is 4 stories wood frame, brick façade with mansard roof on the 4th floor and dormered windows. There are defects at exposure#4 just below dormered windows, ornamental wood work dentil molding is dry rotted. There was no structural instability, no SW shed necessary.
